Posts.Content: Suggest you read the breast cancer clinical trials - there are over 100 trials listed. This way you can read up on different rationales, all of which are based on clinical evidence. Most trials compare the existing 'gold standard' versus the test therapy. [url="http://clinicaltrials.gov/ct/gui/action/SearchAction;jsessionid=D5F32741988340C2 15F3F38222627433?term=breast+cancer&subm it=Search"]http://clinicaltrials.gov/ct/gui/action/Searc hAction;jsessionid=D5F32741988340C215F3F 38222627433?term=breast+cancer&submit=Se arch[/url] The American Cancer Society has a cancer reference site that may also help you evaluate your options. ACS Cancer Reference Information [url="http://www3.cancer.org/cancerinfo"]http://www3.cancer.org/cancerinfo[/url] Within the past couple of years there have been retrospective analyses/studies done on lumpectomy versus radical mastectomy; however, I'm unable to locate the journal citations. Here's a summary article from the National Guidelines Clearinghouse that mentions lumpectomy versus mastectomy: [url="http://www.guideline.gov/VIEWS/summary.asp?guideline=001940&summary_typ e=full_summary&view=full_summary&sSearch _string="]http://www.guideline.gov/VIEWS/summary.asp?guideline=001940&summary_typ e=full_summary&view=full_summary&sSearch _string=[/url] [This message has been edited by Jay Tor (edited 08-07-2002).]
